title: Interior design for a 19th century London aristocratic opium den
description:
I am looking for an interior designer to work with in an iterative manner, part time over the course of 2-3 months to create a conceptual design and then a detailed 3D SketchUp interior of a 12’ by 20’ room decorated to look like a 19th century London opium den for aristocrats. It isn’t clear such places really existed, but there is enough art to recreate their style :)

I have created a design document with a description of the room including photographs I like of each feature of the room. First I want conceptual sketches in Photoshop or Illustrator (or another) format that express your interior design ideas. Once we refine and arrive at a look and feel, I want a precise 3D SketchUp model and renderings of the final design that I can give to a decorator to recreate the design in my next home.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1P-Hntiea2NJZDO1F1ADP7dQE19Pb4cuHk9wr-fMPtkw/edit?usp=sharing

Design influences are from Orientalist painting of the near east in the 18th and 19th centuries, the Ottoman Empire, China, Turkey, Morocco, Egypt and the Levant. Everything in the room is to be deep red / maroon, except perhaps for a few yellow, gold or silver accents. I’m open to ideas for other colors to include but overall it should be dark and maroon.

I want a low maroonOttoman couch along two walls, big maroon pillows, maroon tufted pleather walls, a Moroccan lamp that casts patterns of light hanging from an oval, deep blue recess in the ceiling simulating with LEDs a starry sky at dusk, a recessed flatscreen TV in a wall opposite the couch, 2-3 dark, hardwood wooden bookshelves, a red or maroon hookah, a table equipped with an opium tray with Chinese pipe, lamp and tools. I have photographs I like of all of these things to guide you in my vision for the room.

While I have a vision for the room, you will have creative freedom within the specifications. Impress me with your ideas… we can try more than one concept and iterate! I am not a designer but I did took a series of design classes in school that mean I recognize and appreciate good design. I have experience with a dozen projects collaborating with a design team to create logos, marketing materials, user interfaces and websites. I know how to work with a designer to define a vision and let the designer use their creative capacity to make something amazing. This is a conceptual rather than spec design project that I want you to have fun with!

title: Freelance Senior Backend Developer

We’re Jubilee Media.

At Jubilee, we're on a mission to provoke understanding and create human connection. We explore experiences that push people to feel more, think more, and see more in others. We challenge the belief of a black-and-white world, and instead embrace the complexity and richness of our experiences. By magnifying these stories we can discover personal identities, shared truths, and how we fit in the overarching human story. People are at the heart of everything we do, and we're looking for the next passionate teammate to join us on this journey. Together, we have the power to shift perspectives—and maybe even change the world.

About This Role
 
As a Senior Backend Engineer, you’ll build and scale the backend systems that keep our nectar dating app fast, secure, and always ready to match people at just the right moment. You'll lead our tech and product teams to develop APIs, design architecture that supports millions of users, and make sure the nectar app runs smoothly.
 

What You’ll Do:

- Collaborate cross-functionally with product, growth, and frontend teams to ship high-impact features quickly
- Ensure backend systems are secure, well-documented, and thoroughly tested

Who You Are:

- 7+ years of experience as a professional backend engineer on large scale projects with high traffic
- Expert in Node.js, TypeScript, GraphQL, and Postgres/SQL
- Experience in AWS and/or other cloud providers
- Passion for using the latest AI coding tools and AI-driven best practices to enhance development workflows
- Experience leading a team of developers
- Be an accountable team member who will take ownerships
- Ability to move fast and iterate quickly in a startup environment while maintaining high code quality
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate technical trade-offs effectively
- Nice to have: experience using dating apps, working with remote engineers, worked on mobile applications

Compensation & Perks

- Compensation $60-$80 H^hourly^H – 💰
- Collaborative, supportive, and fun work culture ✨
- Stocked Kitchen 🍪

Work Model

At Jubilee, we follow a hybrid work model — We’re in the El Segundo office 3 days a week and remote for 2.

title: React Native Developer Needed to Build Social Media App (Lightning + Nostr Integration)
description:
I’m looking to hire an experienced mobile app developer to help me build a social media application. The app will be built using React Native (preferably with Expo) and will be available on both iOS and Android. The goal is to create a sleek, modern platform that allows users to post content, follow others,  and tip posts using the Lightning Network, events page, news page, and a market place. The price can be discussed.

At its core, the app will have a home feed where users can browse recent posts, similar to Twitter or Reddit. Users should be able to create an account (either using traditional email, anonymous login, or preferably via Nostr public key login), post content, and view replies. Tipping will be built into the app so that users can send and receive sats (satoshis) directly through Lightning using something like the Breez SDK, LNBits, or another integration of your choice.

I already have a clear vision for the design and user experience and can provide example layouts, screenshots, and UI inspiration. The app will be built with light and dark mode interface, using modern design principles.
For the backend, I’d like to use Supabase (or Firebase if you're more comfortable with that) to handle user accounts, storing posts, and syncing feeds. Ideally, you’ll handle the frontend and backend integration.
This is the first version of the app, but if it goes well, I’m open to an H^ongoing^H collaboration or full-time role. I’m looking for someone who not only writes clean, functional code but also brings a creative eye to the product experience.

When you apply, please share your portfolio, any relevant React Native experience, and whether you’ve worked with cryptocurrency features before. Include a rough estimate of how long this project might take you and what your availability looks like over the next few weeks.

title: Bubble Developer for Facebook SOO and API Integration
description:
***BUBBLE APP***
Hello I'm looking to work with someone on a screen share to resolve two specific issues relating to signing the logging returning users back in after they have created information stored in the database under a temporary user. Please respond if you have previous experience with these issues and are willing to coach me through the implementation.  Thank you 

1) I need help associating temporary data that was created and stored in the database using backend workflows before the user logged in, with the authenticated user when they log in.

2)  My Facebook SSO workflow was functional until I started to passing a unique web_key that are dynamic to the signup page URL (e.g., https://myapp.com/login?web_key=abc123). Facebook requires the OAuth redirect URI to be a static, exact match, which conflicts with the current implementation and is causing facebook to reject the request.   

I'm looking to work with someone who has experience implementing the Facebook dev SSO "state" workflow instructions.  The facebook sso defines indicates that “state" is  a string value created by your app to maintain state between the request and callback. This parameter should be used for preventing [Cross-site Request Forgery] and will be passed back to you, unchanged, in your redirect URI.

title: Setting up a law firm
description:
I recently opened my own law office as a solo practitioner, and I am aiming to create the most efficient, automated, and AI-driven infrastructure for my firm, currently focusing on immigration law. Additionally, I plan to redesign my current website. I want to design my firm in a way that I can delegate or outsource all the non-legal work to others based on the new infrastructure. I am looking to grow my firm in the future. I intend to use and interconnect the following tools in the following steps, unless you have better suggestions. 

Phase 1: Client Intake & Case Creation 
- ✅ Set Up Automated Intake: Configure LawDroid chatbot for handling inquiries and intake forms.
- ✅ Streamline Call Management: Implement Smith.ai to manage phone calls and schedule consultations.
- ✅ Automate Appointment Confirmations: Connect Lawmatics AI for reminders and scheduling.
- ✅ Integrate Intake with Case Management: Use Zapier to send Lawmatics AI data to Clio, triggering case creation.
Phase 2: Case Management & Document Preparation
- ✅ Optimize Immigration Form Processing: Sync Clio with Eimmigration for auto-filling forms.
- ✅ Establish Secure Document Transfers: Ensure Eimmigration (or Docketwise) transfers completed forms to NetDocuments.
- ✅ Automate Payments & Invoicing: Link Lawmatics AI to LawPay, then configure Zapier for payment tracking.
Phase 3: AI-Assisted Legal Research & Case Strategy 
- ✅ Enable AI Research Tools: Activate Casetext’s CoCounsel for case law analysis and ROSS Intelligence for risk assessment.
- ✅ Predict Case Outcomes: Implement Lex Machina to analyze judge rulings.
- ✅ Sync Research Insights with Case Management: Use Zapier to feed legal research findings into Clio for real-time strategy updates.
Phase 4: Financial & Compliance Management
- ✅ Automate Accounting: Set up Pilot AI Accounting to sync billable hours from Clio.
- ✅ Secure Payment Processing: Configure LawPay for seamless invoicing.
- ✅ Enhance Cybersecurity & Compliance: Deploy AbacusNext AI with NetDocuments for security alerts.
Phase 5: AI-Powered Marketing & Client Outreach 
- ✅ Boost Online Presence: Optimize SEO with FindLaw AI for improved client acquisition.
- ✅ Automate Social Media Engagement: Use Buffer AI for content scheduling.
- ✅ Refine Advertising Strategies: Analyze inquiries with CallRail AI and sync insights with HubSpot CRM.
Phase 6: AI-Assisted Litigation & Predictive Analytics 
- ✅ Automate Legal Motions & Case Preparation: Use Harvey AI for document generation.
- ✅ Fine-Tune Litigation Strategy: Enable Lex Machina for judge ruling analysis.
- ✅ Assess Opposing Counsel Strategies: Leverage Premonition AI before hearings.
- ✅ Sync Litigation Insights with Case Management: Configure Zapier for real-time updates in Clio.

title: Canon EDSDK Python Script Debug - Camera Control Specialist
description:
Project Description:

  I need a developer to debug and enhance my Python scripts that uses Canon EDSDK for programmatic camera control. The script needs to properly handle camera awakening, photo capture via shutter button simulation, and programmable zoom and exposure adjustment based on hardcoded parameters. I have some of these commands working, but other ones can be found in the EDSDK that I will provide as part of the codebase.

  Key Requirements:

  - Debug and improve camera control functionality including:
    - Camera wake-up sequences
    - Shutter button control for taking photos
    - Programmatic exposure adjustment via parameters
    - Handling camera power cycling gracefully
    - Proper image saving and interaction with other script components
  - Add ability to set camera to specific zoom levels
  - Create modular code structure in camera_control_service.py for easy addition of future EDSDK commands
  - Implement proper threading for camera operations (using Windows COM STA)
  - Provide clean, informative terminal output for users

  Essential Qualifications:
  - MUST own or have access to a Canon camera for your own local testing (ideally a Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark III)
  - Must use Windows as development environment
  - Experience with Canon EDSDK or similar camera control SDKs
  - Strong Python programming skills with experience in hardware integration
  - Experience with multi-threaded applications
  - Understanding of proper resource management for hardware devices
  - Git version control
  - Knowledge of AI LLMs (for code review, commit messages, PRs, and regular communications)

  Additional Information:

  - Code access will be provided on an as-needed basis
  - Thorough testing and documentation is required
  - Communication in English is essential

  Expected Deliverables:

  - Debugged and improved camera control script
  - Implementation of zoom level control
  - Documentation of changes and usage
  - Testing report demonstrating all functionality works
  - Daily status updates, clear communication via messages, screenshots, screen recordings, and/or video calls
  - Signed NDA etc. for access to codebase

title: 📰 Newsletter Marketing Manager (Remote, Part-Time or Contract)

Location: Remote

Compensation: $1,500–$4,000/H^month^H depending on experience

📣 About Us
Pre-IPO Hype is a performance-driven fundraising agency helping startups raise capital through equity crowdfunding. We’ve led over 200+ campaigns and are now building a world-class newsletter to spotlight founders, decode investor trends, and drive capital formation at scale.

We’re looking for a Newsletter Marketing Manager to run point on our entire newsletter operation—from content strategy and production to distribution and performance optimization.

✍️ What You'll Own

Run the Newsletter Engine: Own the calendar, production process, and weekly publishing of a longform (~3,000–4,000 word) investor newsletter

Manage Distribution Channels: Use GoHighLevel (GHL) and ConvertKit to manage lists, segmentation, A/B testing, and deliverability

Coordinate Contributor Pipeline: Collaborate with our CEO, analysts, and campaign leads to collect story inputs and market insights

Drive Growth Loops: Set up referral systems, email-gated lead magnets, and social clip tie-ins to boost subscriber growth

Track Performance: Build simple dashboards to monitor open rates, CTR, growth rate, campaign response, and churn

🔍 What We’re Looking For
3–5+ years in newsletter marketing, editorial strategy, or investor content

Proven success building or running newsletters (Substack, ConvertKit, GHL, Beehiiv, etc.)

Exceptional editorial judgment and ability to polish longform, high-caliber writing

Familiarity with investor audiences and capital markets (angel, Reg CF, VC)

Operational mindset: can systematize content creation, feedback, and publishing

Comfort working with AI tools (GPT, Relevance AI) to accelerate editorial workflows

Bonus: background in finance, startup media, or creator marketing

💻 Tools You'll Use
GoHighLevel (GHL) – email marketing, list segmentation, drip campaigns

ConvertKit / Substack / Beehiiv – for optional expansion/testing

Notion or Airtable – editorial calendar & workflow

Grammarly / ChatGPT / Claude / Jasper – content refinement

Fathom / Fireflies – note-taking and insight extraction

Google Analytics / GHL Dashboards – performance tracking

📆 Engagement Details
Remote + async friendly

5–10 hrs/week (varies by publishing cadence)

$1,500–$4,000/H^month^H depending on experience and volume

Initial 3-H^month^H contract with opportunity to expand to editorial lead

🚀 How to Apply

1–2 links to newsletters you’ve run (or written for)

A paragraph on how you’d structure a weekly investor-focused newsletter

Your favorite newsletter of all time (and why)

Subject Line: Newsletter Manager – [Your Name]

title: Senior Java 17 Engineer – High-Performance Runtime Server (40 hrs/wk, Healthcare, Interoperability)
description:
Who we are

An 11,000-person U.S. healthcare software company. Our flagship runtime platform executes customer-designed data-exchange workflows at scale. We’re expanding our India team and can convert the right freelancer to a full-time employee.

⸻

What you’ll do

	•	Design, code and ship new features for a Java 17 server runtime (Spring 6 under the hood; OSGi legacy being phased out).
	•	Profile & fix low-latency, multithreaded performance issues and troubleshoot customer incidents.
	•	Modernize modules and the tech stack.
	•	Review merge requests and collaborate with U.S./India/Eastern Europe engineers.
	•	40 hrs/week, long-term engagement.

⸻

Core tech stack

Java 17 · Multithreading/Concurrency · Kafka & JMS · MS SQL Server / Oracle / Postgres · GitLab · Kubernetes · Spring 6
Bonus: AWS/Azure · FHIR/HL7

⸻

Must-have experience

	•	6+ years building enterprise back-end products that are secure, highly available and horizontally scalable.
	•	Advanced concurrency & performance tuning in Java.
	•	Designing and optimizing relational-DB data paths.

⸻

Nice-to-haves

Helm · AWS/Azure · OpenSearch/Elasticsearch · OAuth 2.0 · Healthcare interoperability (FHIR/HL7)

⸻

How we work

	•	Source control: GitLab
	•	Remote, flexible hours aligned with India / Eastern Europe time zones; 40 hrs/week
	•	Hiring process: technical screen → one panel interview.

⸻

Compensation

Target range $30 – $40/hr; please justify any higher rate with relevant achievements. Stretch is possible for an exceptional fit.

⸻

To apply — read carefully

	1.	Link to a public GitHub repo or attach a code sample that showcases multithreaded Java you authored.
	2.	In ≤ 150 words, describe the toughest multithreaded bug you solved in production and how you H^fixed^H it.
	3.	Confirm you are currently based in India and state your H^hourly^H rate & earliest start date.

Applications missing any of the three items will be skipped.
No agencies, please—we’re looking for an individual super-star engineer who loves hard performance problems and wants a stable, long-term role in healthcare tech.

title: Realtek rtl8188ftv Wireless Regulatory Test Driver on STM32MP1
description:
We are looking for an experienced developer to help us find and deliver regulatory test drivers for the Realtek rtl8188ftv wireless driver, specifically tailored for the STM32MP1 OpenSTLinux platform. 

The vendor supplied tool is also referred to as "MP Tool", it comprises of two parts- a user-space utility, and a kernel driver which has the specific test firmware that loads onto the chip. 

We have a user-space application provided by the manufacturer, but it does not work with the wifi kernel driver we are using.  We don't seem to have the correct kernel driver.

Successful completion of this project would be the ability to use the MP tool to set the chip in the right modes so we can do RF regulatory testing.   This should be a very quick project for someone who has done this before.

title: Penetration Test for B2B SaaS App (Angular Frontend, API Backend on AWS)
description:
Description:

We are looking for an experienced and certified penetration tester to conduct a security assessment of our B2B SaaS application. Our app is built with an Angular frontend, with backend APIs running in AWS. 

We require this pen test to harden our systems, comply with customer requests, and comply with SOC2. If the requirements below are not sufficient or are out-of-place, please note any modifications you would make.

Scope of Work:
* Frontend Penetration Testing (Angular):
  ** Test for common web application vulnerabilities (XSS, CSRF, Insecure Direct Object References, etc.).
  ** Assess session management and authentication flow.
  ** Validate input validation and output encoding.
  ** Review the security of client-side interactions with APIs.

* API Penetration Testing:
  ** Test for common API vulnerabilities (such as SQL injection, authentication flaws, improper rate limiting, etc.).
  ** Evaluate the security of authentication mechanisms (OAuth 2.0, API keys, JWT tokens).
  ** Check for vulnerabilities like information leakage or privilege escalation.

Requirements:
* Proven experience with penetration testing, especially for web applications, APIs, and cloud infrastructure (AWS).
* Certifications like OSCP, CEH, or similar are a plus.
* Ability to provide detailed reports with findings, risk assessments, and remediation recommendations.
* Previous experience testing Angular applications and AWS environments.

Deliverables:
* A detailed report outlining vulnerabilities found, including proof of concept (where applicable).
* Recommendations for securing the application and infrastructure.
* Retesting (optional) after fixes have been applied.

Timeline:
* Please provide your estimated timeline for completing the testing and delivering the final report.

Budget:
* Please submit your proposals along with your H^hourly^H rate and any relevant past experience.

	•	Crash or tower risk-style games

⸻

	3.	In-Game Engagement Features (REQUIRED)

	6.	Backend & Hosting

	7.	Compliance Requirements
	•	No in-game references to gambling or real money

title: AI Tool Development for Roof Replacement Insights
description:
We are seeking an experienced developer to create an AI-enabled tool designed for homeowners and roofing contractors. This tool will provide strategic insights into optimal roof replacement strategies, helping users make informed decisions based on data-driven analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AI development and knowledge of regulatory and insurance frameworks.
Objective:
To design and develop an AI-enabled tool/dashboard capable of providing homeowners, roofing contractors, and insurance adjusters with strategic insights into the optimal roof replacement or repair strategy for individual properties in state of Colorado, USA. This tool will synthesize complex data sets from regulatory, meteorological, and insurance sources to deliver personalized, actionable recommendations.
Scope of Work
The selected Virtual Assistant (VA) or contractor will assist in the research, data integration, and interface planning necessary to support the development of this AI tool. Responsibilities include:
1. Regulatory Data Collection & Structuring
Research and compile Colorado state roofing requirements, including local code variations by municipality and county.
Summarize regulations governing materials, pitch, installation standards, and permitting.
2. Insurance Provider Criteria Analysis
Identify and extract relevant data on roof repair/replacement criteria from leading insurance companies operating in Colorado (e.g., State Farm, Allstate, USAA, Farmers).
Include distinctions for coverage policies, age of roof limits, material type considerations, and claims history impacts.
3. Predictive Hail & Weather Damage Modeling
Assist in sourcing or recommending integration with third-party APIs or open datasets for historical and predictive hail and severe weather data (e.g., NOAA, HailStrike, AccuWeather).
Help define the framework for AI-powered damage risk assessment, including geolocation and seasonal patterns.
4. Homeowner Financial Data Inputs
Identify common deductible structures and out-of-pocket cost thresholds for roof repairs or replacements.
Develop a basic model for integrating cost-benefit analysis based on homeowner’s policy, roof age, and damage risk profile.
5. Dashboard Planning and User Experience Design
Collaborate in planning the dashboard wireframe or prototype, ensuring a user-friendly interface for inputting property information and visualizing output.
Support documentation and mapping of data flow and AI model outputs.
Expected Deliverables
Compiled and organized data sources with citations (spreadsheets, databases, or structured docs)
Summary briefs on regulatory, insurance, and weather criteria
Recommendations for data integrations (API or bulk data)
Wireframe mockups or dashboard flowcharts (can be done in tools like Make, Figma, Canva, or Lucidchart)
Weekly progress updates and final project brief.
Your expertise will contribute to transforming how roofing projects are planned and executed.

n8n automation that:

Pulls from structured examples (in Google Sheets or Airtable)

Sends context to Azure OpenAI GPT (you’ll write/optimize prompts)

Returns implementation drafts in plain English

Triggers a human review flow (via email, Slack, or Google Form)

On approval, appends the text to a System Security Plan (SSP) doc in Google Docs or Markdown
Deep experience with n8n and building multi-step workflows

Azure OpenAI or OpenAI API integration (GPT-4 preferred)

Experience building human-in-the-loop workflows (email, form, or messaging)

Able to export generated content to Google Docs, Markdown, or DOCX

title: Senior Data Engineer - Analytics Experience and CPG Industry a Plus
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer with proven experience in the CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods) industry, specifically with market data and analytical models for the US and Europe regions. The ideal candidate will have hands-on expertise in Azure Databricks, Data Factory, ADLS, and PySpark, and a solid understanding of data engineering best practices and data structures.
You will be responsible for building robust and scalable ETL pipelines, working closely with business analysts, data scientists, and product teams to transform raw data into valuable business insights.

Key Responsibilities:
·	Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance ETL/ELT pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, PySpark, and ADLS Gen2.
·	Collaborate with business and analytics teams to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions tailored to CPG workflows such as shipment tracking, POS integration, retail analytics, and trade promotions.
·	Work on ingestion, transformation, quality checks, and enrichment of large-scale datasets from disparate sources.
·	Implement and manage data lakehouse architectures, applying Delta Lake principles for unified batch and streaming ingestion.
·	Ensure data quality, integrity, security, and compliance with GDPR and US data protection norms.
·	Use performance tuning techniques to optimize complex PySpark and SQL queries in Databricks.
·	Contribute to the CI/CD process for data pipeline deployment and version control (Git-based workflows).
·	Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Data Scientists, BI Engineers, DevOps) and mentor junior engineers when needed.
·	Prepare documentation, data dictionaries, and technical guides as part of the delivery process.
·	Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and agile development practices.

Required Qualifications:
·	5+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering roles.
·	Domain experience working with CPG data for US and/or European markets.
·	Strong expertise in: Azure Databricks (including Delta Lake), Azure Data Factory (ADF), Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS), PySpark and Spark SQL.

Preferred Qualifications:

title: Supabase Functions and Triggers Expert
description:
Description:
I’m looking for a Supabase expert to help implement a set of database functions and triggers I've already mapped out. While I have a solid background in Google AppSheet and App Script, I need someone with deeper experience in Supabase’s backend features to handle implementation, optimization, and workflow validation. I do not have the time to learn all the nuances that come with Supabase at the moment. I just need my flows completed. 

Current Stack:
- Frontend: Deployed on Vercel (Next.js)
- Backend: Supabase (Postgres + Auth + Storage)
- Functions: Primarily serverless workflows
- External Integrations: Some functions will need to interact with external APIs such as OpenAI and Google APIs

What’s Already Done:
- Tables and schemas are fully defined and organized
- Workflows are documented with clear logic for each function/trigger
- Some draft SQL and initial triggers are in place
- Environment is clean, version-controlled, and ready for implementation

What You’ll Help With:
- Writing and deploying Postgres functions and event-driven triggers inside Supabase
- Implementing workflows that require making secure external HTTP calls (OpenAI, Google APIs, etc.)
- Ensuring event logic triggers correctly and handles async responses when needed
- Optimizing SQL for performance and scalability
- Validating that all edge workflows operate correctly via Supabase + Vercel
- Advising on best practices for RLS (Row-Level Security) and role-based access
- General cleanup and light support on logic-related troubleshooting

Ideal Candidate:
- Advanced experience with Supabase and Postgres (PL/pgSQL)
- Strong understanding of edge/serverless function architecture
- Familiar with making external API calls within database workflows or via Supabase Edge Functions

Bonus: Experience with OpenAI API, Google Apps APIs, or similar services

Clear communicator who can provide thoughtful feedback on implementation choices

Budget & Timeline:

Budget: Tight, im behind and don't have a ton of room to spare. 

Timeline: Targeting completion within 1–2 weeks based on implementing one workflow at a time and ensuring that the database flows seamlessly with the front end. 

To Apply:
Please include links or summaries of previous work involving Supabase (especially triggers/functions and external API calls). Let me know if you’ve worked in Vercel or similar serverless environments before. (put Edge Function in title so I know you read this completely. I also will know if you used chatgpt to write your letter so please respond accordingly)

title: ChromeOS Device Certificates Extension
description:
Implement a Chrome extension to issue user certificates on ChromeOS using Google’s verification API and an issuing service in GCP.

The chrome extension will run on the enterprise-enrolled chromebook, generate the certificate request, and submit it to a backend service.

The backend must be implemented using GCP’s Cloud Run. The backend must:
1) Verify the user identity (possibly using GCP’s Identity-Aware Proxy)
2) Verify the device and that is it enterprise enrolled with Google’s Verification API
3) Sign the CSR using a CA key stored in GCP KMS (in hardware-backed storage)
4) Return the signed certificate to the extension

See attached file for a more detailed outline.

description:
CesiumJS + Next.js Developer Needed: Interactive 3D Map with Dynamic Layers, Building Selection, and Chat Integration

Overview:

The application will visualize a 3D map with dynamically updatable layers, allow users to select buildings from GeoJSON, and interact with a chat component (for AI or support functions).
What You’ll Build:
A modular Next.js component using CesiumJS to render a 3D globe.
Support for dynamic layer updates—e.g., adding/removing imagery or 3D tile sets in real-time.
Interactive selection of buildings defined in GeoJSON, with custom highlighting and metadata display.
Integration with a chat interface (we’ll provide APIs or design for it) that:
Reacts to user map interactions.
Allows the chat to trigger map updates.

Must-Have Skills:
Strong experience with CesiumJS (Entities, 3D Tiles, DataSources, camera controls, layer management).
Proficient in React.js and Next.js (especially server-side rendering and dynamic imports).
Experience working with GeoJSON for mapping data and interactivity.
Ability to handle events like clicks/selections on Cesium entities and connect them to UI responses.

Deliverables:
A Next.js-compatible CesiumJS component with:
Layer control and update logic.
GeoJSON-based building interactivity.
Integration hooks for chat response handling.
Code should be modular, clean, and well-documented for future extensibility.
Bonus: Please include links to similar projects or demos you’ve built with CesiumJS and/or React/Next.js.

title: Developer for UI/Software Integration (APIs for OpenProject/Bryntum)
description:
Overview: Our small manufacturing business has grown our client base spanning from traditional automotive to aerospace and full builds for entertainment clients. As the number of clients grew, so did the amount of projects and  employees so we needed to create a system/software to track progress across all stages of a project and assign resources on a daily basis to help meet deadlines. 

 OpenProject was the software chosen to manage projects and tasks, and assign tasks to employees and machines, which is open source and built on Ruby on Rails (this replaced a home-grown internal system with Powerpoint and Access):
www.Openproject.com 
https://github.com/opf/openproject

Software Background: Using the new PM software has been successful in giving a high-level board showing ‘who is working on what’ or ‘what machine is working on what’but lacks the time estimates and time tracking in order to tell the CEO when a person or machine could free up.  The desire now is to develop a view which could quickly show how long each task would take by person, or by machine. Bryntum offers a set of web components, out of the box, that provides user-friendly interfaces  similar to this view:https://bryntum.com/products/schedulerpro/examples/grouping/ 
Or this view may also meet the needs: 
https://bryntum.com/products/schedulerpro/examples-scheduler/vertical-dependencies/ 

Other requirements:
-Software to be on-premise, not on the cloud (due to security/ secure data stored) 
-Using new UI/UX will not hinder/negatively impact the OpenProject s/w updates
-Data entered in UI using Bryntum web components will populate in OpenProject database and other views already seen (ie fix one view, it will auto populate the other view)
-Change does not ‘break’ the on-premise OpenProject software, ie when they do updates
Deliverable:  View/UX of a schedule that can be filtered by person or by machine, by the hour

Development request/job:
Confirm that Bryntum works as a solution for developing this view by hour/by day (ie, should we move forward to buy a license for Bryntum?)
Is there an OpenProject API to populate Bryntum components?
If not, what is an alternative solution?
Estimate the amount of hours and weeks it would take for a developer to take on creating this view
Is this development using React, Angular and/or Ruby on Rails?
